intro: Sapranthus palanga, commonly known as the Palanga bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant features showy, blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Sapranthus palanga is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in full sun.
